choices.answer: Gold
Silver
Lead
None of the above

questions.question: Why does Antonio borrow money from Shylock?

choices.answer: to travel to Belmont
to give money to Bassanio
to pay off Bassanio's loans
to pay for his lost ships

questions.question: Which casket does the Prince of Arragon choose?

choices.answer: Gold
Silver
Lead
None of the above

questions.question: How does Portia help Bassanio choose the correct casket?

choices.answer: She puts wine on top of the correct casket.
She secretly tells him the right one before he chooses.
She stands behind the correct casket.
She plays a song that tells him the answer.

questions.question: Which casket does the Prince of Morroco choose?

choices.answer: Gold
Silver
Lead
none of the above

questions.question: How does Portia save Antonio's life?

choices.answer: She tells Shylock he can't have anything but flesh.
She tells Shylock he can't make Antonio bleed.
She tells Shylock he threatened Antonio's life and must die.
All of the above.

questions.question: Why does Gratanio want to join Bassanio in Belmont?

choices.answer: He wants to help Bassanio win Portia.
He is secretly in love with Nerissa.
He wants to help Jessica escape from Shylock.
He wants to get out of Venice, away from Shylock.

questions.question: Why does Launcelot want to leave Shylock?

choices.answer: He says Shylock doesn't feed him well.
He doesn't like Jews very much.
He thinks he'll become a Jew if he stays with Shylock.
All of the above.

questions.question: What did the wives convince their husbands of?

choices.answer: They said they slept with the men to get the rings back.
They said they bought new rings to replace their husbands'.
They said they stole the rings from the men.
They said they want a divorce.

questions.question: Why is Shylock not in the final act of the play?

choices.answer: His story is finished.
His story is tragic but the play is a comedy.
He is the only one whose life doesn't end happily.
All of the above.

questions.question: What are the four main plots of the play?

choices.answer: suitor plot, elopement plot, monkey plot, ring plot
bond plot, ring plot, casket plot, elopement plot
bond plot, ships plot, flesh plot, courtroom plot
bond plot, casket plot, gold plot, marriage plot

questions.question: Which of the following is an example of dramatic irony?

choices.answer: when Shylock hears that Jessica trades the ring for a monkey
when the husbands say they will trade wives for Antonio
when Shylock sharpens his knife during the trial
when Antonio borrows money from Shylock for Bassanio

questions.question: What does Shylock say in his "I am a Jew" speech?

choices.answer: that Jews and Christians are the same
that he will seek revenge for wrongs just like Christians
that Jews bleed, laugh, and feel the same way Christians do
all of the above

questions.question: Is this play a comedy or a tragedy and why?

choices.answer: Comedy: No one dies.
Tragedy: Shylock's life is destroyed.
Comedy: Happy ending.
Tragedy: Antonio and Shylock are still all alone.

questions.question: Why does Shylock want his pound of flesh so badly?

choices.answer: because Antonio has spit on Shylock and called him names
because Antonio has taken business away from Shylock
because Shylock thinks Antonio helped Jessica escape
all of the above
